text: (born 9 March 1962 in Kumamoto) is a retired long-distance runner from Japan, who represented his native country at the 1992 Summer Olympics. His personal best in the men's 10,000 metres was 28:18.15, achieved at the 1991 World Championships. Urata won four national titles during his career: in the 5,000 (1988 and 1989) and in the 10,000 metres (1988 and 1989). ==Achievements== {| |- |1985 |Asian Championships |Jakarta, Indonesia |2nd |5,000 m |- |1991 |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |11th |10,000 m |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |14th |10,000 m |} ==References== * Profile * sports- reference Category:Japanese male long-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Japan Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
title: Haruo Urata
